Summary Heading: Hotel policies on cancelations for emergency situtations unacceptable.
Summary: Made a advanced reservation for a room at this hotel.  For a Friday evening.  Was admitted to the Hospital that morning with a life threating situation.  My wife called the reservation desk that morning plus the Holiday Inn national number requesting a cancelation.  Subsequent to the call this hotel went a head and charged us "because of their reservation policies".  Called and talked to the Manager re-explained the situation and she offered NO flexibility.  Can not believe a company as big as Holiday Inn has no compassion for their customers caught in a emergency situations.  I am even a rewards member.  I can't believe a service company can be so greedy. Will never stay with this chain again.
Manager Response: Mike R,  On behalf of our entire staff I want to apologize that you were not able to arrive for your reservation at our hotel.  We apologize that you did were not satisfied with the hotel's policies regarding your reservation, hotel rooms like airplane tickets have terms and conditions, and the reservation you chose had a discounted rate in exchange for waiving your right to cancel your reservation.  We hope to have another opportunity to serve you again in the future.  If you have any questions please feel free to contact the hotel directly.  Thank You

Summary Heading: Enjoyed my overnight stay in this very comfortable Holiday Inn

The price for a king bed was less than $100 for the Sunday night.  The room was fresh, clean and spacious for one person.  They provided all the nice little amenities complimentary in the room such as the coffee maker, a microwave, a refrigerator.  They folded their towels  and the end of the toilet paper roll in a fan shape which added a nice touch.  At check in, the desk clerk asked if I wanted to be close or far from the elevator which I felt was thoughtful.  With no preference I was given room 311, the midway point. This is the floor with the fitness center.   I used one of the computers in the first floor business center to check in with my airline
Manager Response: Dear MAbelini, Thank you for a lovely review. We are glad that you had a nice stay. Please do visit again. Sincerely, R Dalgado

Bathrooms clean. Fridge and microwave WITH free parking! Staff was friendly and helpful. Bed was a little soft. Linens were clean and soft but a little worn. Breakfast buffet was typical. Eggs, hash browns, bacon and sausage w muffins and such.  Had a fantastic Chinese dinner a hop, skip, and jump away at Olive Time. Likely would stay again!
Manager Response: Dear Ahyiweewee, We do appreciate you taking the time to write a review and your detailed explanations of the hotel and area. Safe travels. Sincerely, R Dalgado

The staff is very flexible and willing to help make the whole experience excellent. We catered lunch and snacks from the hotel for 3 days and all the food was delicious. Will definitely come back in the future!

I ended up being pleasantly surprised by the accommodations, especially compared to the other local options (more about that in a minute).  No complaints whatsoever about the room. I appreciate this hotel and the effort they put into making it a classy and comfortable place to stay.

Despite being right next to the freeway, the rooms were quiet with no road noise. This is not a particularly charming place to stay, but for our purposes it was perfect. The room was large enough for a family of 4, with a fridge and microwave and the beds were comfortable.  Only two quibbles - the AC is noisy and blows straight onto the beds so that might not work for a light sleeper (it did not bother me but disturbed one of my family members). Also, the breakfast was good, but the staff was a problem.  Our waiter got the orders wrong, brought an order that was missing several key parts, forgot to bring us flatware or butter, had to be asked several times

So, I decided to give it a try. It's called the Aqua Lounge. The food was great, but the service is what really made it stand out to me. The bartender/waitress (Dani) was awesome. She was friendly and sweet to my children and I. She was very patient and kind to my daughter who is autistic and not always easy for people to deal with. Dani took it all in stride, with a smile on her face. After our delicious meal, my daughter asked her for a hug. Which she gladly gave her. Awesome is all I can say! Great service, and I'll be recommending both the hotel and restraint to any and all visiting family and friends!

I just drink coffee in the morning and there is a coffee machine in the room and also complimentary coffee bar in the lobby. They have Live entertainment on some night and Karaoke on Sunday nights. Good food and cocktails! Nice staff and Bartender.

We mentioned this to the duty manager the following morning who was very appologetic and  promised a room on the second floor. Needless to say, our second night at the hotel was much quieter. Manager Response: Hello and13Tenby,  Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience on TripAdvisor. Tried all 3 meals at the on premise restaurant, which is surprisingly good. Location was perfect for our long weedend trip visiting the Saddleback Church, as well as the coastal beaches. When we traveled to LA, we have paid more than double the rate and got less hotel. This one is definitely a gem!

The lobby nicely decorated, the parking lot - not a bit of trash to be found, the hotel staff warm and well-versed in the local "what to do and where to eat", and our room - spotless! For such a great price - SOLD!  Close to Dana Point, shopping, great places to eat, they even have a hot tub and pool after a long day... If you can stand the cool air after a long soak! The only noise that disturbed us was a child crying in the hallway outside our door early in the morning which can happen anywhere.We will be back in a few weeks!

Summary Heading: Good fall back when not in Laguna
Summary: Stayed for a week on business trip. Ever.  -FREE parking (and lots of it) -Lobby area was nice, staff was friendly at the front desk and restaurant -Clean room, updated decor. -Room right by the freeway but NO freeway noise. Very quiet. -Breakfast buffet was a great value (see below) -Good area/location -Restaurant/bar downstairs with good drink deals  Cons: -Room was small but not TOO bad for two people on a short trip -No fan in the bathroom -Free WiFi was TERRIBLE, could not connect in our room  Breakfast: If you have the option,

Summary Heading: Great Hotel w/ the Amenities that Count
Summary: This was one of the nicest Holiday Inn's I've ever stayed at and I must say I was quite impressed. Manager Response: Dear Brian M,  Thank you for your most recent visit to our hotel and for your kind comments!
